original_solution_mapping.L1: Alexander has sent pictures to a total of 1 original gallery + 5 new galleries = <<1+5=6>>6 galleries.
original_solution_mapping.L2: For signatures, he has used a total of 6 galleries * 2 pencils per gallery = <<6*2=12>>12 pencils.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So of the pencils that he used, 88 total pencils - 12 signature pencils = <<88-12=76>>76 pencils for drawings.
original_solution_mapping.L4: At the first gallery, he used 9 pictures * 4 pencils per picture = <<9*4=36>>36 pencils.
original_solution_mapping.L5: So in the new galleries, he used 76 total pencils for drawings - 36 pencils at the first gallery = <<76-36=40>>40 pencils.
original_solution_mapping.L6: The new galleries received a total of 40 pencils / 4 pencils per picture = <<40/4=10>>10 pictures.
original_solution_mapping.L7: As the new galleries all receive equal amounts of pictures, each gallery must have 10 pictures / 5 galleries = <<10/5=2>>2 pictures per gallery.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6755.
    Returns: the number of paintings at each of the 5 new galleries.
    """
    # L1
    original_galleries = 1 # 9 pictures for an exhibition at a gallery
    new_galleries = 5 # 5 new galleries
    total_galleries = original_galleries + new_galleries

    # L2
    pencils_per_exhibition_signature = 2 # another 2 pencils for signing his signature
    total_signature_pencils = total_galleries * pencils_per_exhibition_signature

    # L3
    total_pencils_used = 88 # If Alexander uses 88 pencils on drawing and signing his pictures
    pencils_for_drawings = total_pencils_used - total_signature_pencils

    # L4
    original_gallery_pictures = 9 # draws 9 pictures for an exhibition at a gallery
    pencils_per_picture = 4 # For each picture, Alexander needs 4 pencils
    pencils_for_original_gallery = original_gallery_pictures * pencils_per_picture

    # L5
    pencils_for_new_galleries = pencils_for_drawings - pencils_for_original_gallery

    # L6
    total_pictures_new_galleries = pencils_for_new_galleries / pencils_per_picture

    # L7
    pictures_per_new_gallery = total_pictures_new_galleries / new_galleries

    # FA
    answer = pictures_per_new_gallery
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Alexander has sent pictures to a total of {original_galleries} original gallery + {new_galleries} new galleries = <<{original_galleries}+{new_galleries}={total_galleries}>>{total_galleries} galleries.

For signatures, he has used a total of {total_galleries} galleries * {pencils_per_exhibition_signature} pencils per gallery = <<{total_galleries}*{pencils_per_exhibition_signature}={total_signature_pencils}>>{total_signature_pencils} pencils.

So of the pencils that he used, {total_pencils_used} total pencils - {total_signature_pencils} signature pencils = <<{total_pencils_used}-{total_signature_pencils}={pencils_for_drawings}>>{pencils_for_drawings} pencils for drawings.

At the first gallery, he used {original_gallery_pictures} pictures * {pencils_per_picture} pencils per picture = <<{original_gallery_pictures}*{pencils_per_picture}={pencils_for_original_gallery}>>{pencils_for_original_gallery} pencils.

So in the new galleries, he used {pencils_for_drawings} total pencils for drawings - {pencils_for_original_gallery} pencils at the first gallery = <<{pencils_for_drawings}-{pencils_for_original_gallery}={pencils_for_new_galleries}>>{pencils_for_new_galleries} pencils.

The new galleries received a total of {pencils_for_new_galleries} pencils / {pencils_per_picture} pencils per picture = <<{pencils_for_new_galleries}/{pencils_per_picture}={total_pictures_new_galleries}>>{total_pictures_new_galleries} pictures.

As the new galleries all receive equal amounts of pictures, each gallery must have {total_pictures_new_galleries} pictures / {new_galleries} galleries = <<{total_pictures_new_galleries}/{new_galleries}={pictures_per_new_gallery}>>{pictures_per_new_gallery} pictures per gallery.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So of the pencils that he used, 88 total pencils - 12 signature pencils = <<88-12=76>>76 pencils for drawings.
